TypeSignature.Value: Public NotInheritable Class AudioRecordingConfiguration Inherits Object Implements IDisposable, IJavaPeerable, IParcelable
public ref class AudioRecordingConfiguration sealed : Java::Lang::Object, Android::OS::IParcelable, IDisposable, Java::Interop::IJavaPeerable
public sealed class AudioRecordingConfiguration : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AudioRecordingConfiguration extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type AudioRecordingConfiguration = class inherit Object interface IParcelable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: The AudioRecordingConfiguration class collects the information describing an audio recording session.

remarks.para: The AudioRecordingConfiguration class collects the information describing an audio recording session.

Direct polling (see AudioManager#getActiveRecordingConfigurations()) or callback (see AudioManager#registerAudioRecordingCallback(android.media.AudioManager.AudioRecordingCallback, android.os.Handler) methods are ways to receive information about the current recording configuration of the device.

An audio recording configuration contains information about the recording format as used by the application (#getClientFormat(), as well as the recording format actually used by the device (#getFormat()). The two recording formats may, for instance, be at different sampling rates due to hardware limitations (e.g. application recording at 44.1kHz whereas the device always records at 48kHz, and the Android framework resamples for the application).

The configuration also contains the use case for which audio is recorded (#getClientAudioSource()), enabling the ability to distinguish between different activities such as ongoing voice recognition or camcorder recording.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns information about the audio input device used for this recording.
Docs.value: the audio recording device or null if this information cannot be retrieved

remarks.para: Returns information about the audio input device used for this recording.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AudioSource As Integer
public: property int AudioSource { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the audio source currently used to configure the capture path.
Docs.value: the audio source active on the capture path.

remarks.para: Returns the audio source currently used to configure the capture path. It can be different from the source returned by #getClientAudioSource() if another capture is active.

Docs.summary: Returns the audio format at which the client application is recording audio.

remarks.para: Returns the audio format at which the client application is recording audio. Note that it may differ from the actual recording format (see #getFormat()).

Docs.summary: Returns true if the audio returned to the client is currently being silenced by the audio framework due to concurrent capture policy (e.
Docs.value: true if captured audio is silenced, false otherwise .
